5KG0.F.summary: Bluelake Mineral AB (publ) operates as a mineral exploration company. It explores for nickel and gold deposits, as well as hydrocarbons. The company owns interests in the RÃ¶nnbÃ¤cken project, which covers an area of approximately 15 square kilometers located in VÃ¤sterbotten, Sweden; OrrbÃ¤cken project covering an area of approximately 261 hectares located in VÃ¤sterbotten, Sweden; and Kattisavan project covering 888 hectares located in Lapland, Sweden. It also owns interests in the Ellej-Igajskoje license located in Tomsk Oblast, Russia. The company was formerly known as Nickel Mountain Resources AB (publ) and changed its name to Bluelake Mineral AB (publ) in December 2020. The company was incorporated in 1994 and is headquartered in Gothenburg, Sweden. Bluelake Mineral AB (publ) is a subsidiary of Archelon AB (publ).

5KP.F.summary: Copperstone Resources AB operates as a base and precious metals exploration company in Sweden. The company primarily explores for copper, zinc, gold, and silver ores, as well as cobalt and iron ores. It holds 100% interests in the Copperstone project located on the southeast of Arvidsjaur. The company also has interests Viscaria Copper project located in the Kiruna region.  The company was formerly known as Kopparberg Mineral AB (publ) and changed its name to Copperstone Resources AB (publ) in February 2015. Copperstone Resources AB (publ) was founded in 2006 and is headquatered in Danderyd, Sweden.

ARCT.ST.summary: Arctic Minerals AB (publ), through its subsidiaries, engages in exploration and mining of mineral properties in the Norway and Sweden. The company explores for gold, copper, and zinc deposits. It primarily holds interests in Bidjovagge gold-copper project that covers a total of 9 extraction permits totaling 7.16 square kilometers at Bidjovagge, as well as 1 exploration permit covering 1 square kilometer located in Finnmark, Northern Norway. The company was formerly known as Arctic Gold AB (publ) and changed its name to Arctic Minerals AB (publ) in December 2017. Arctic Minerals AB (publ) was founded in 1999 and is based in Ãstersund, Sweden.

BDNNY.summary: Boliden AB (publ) engages in exploring, extracting, and processing base metals and precious metals in Sweden, other Nordic region, Germany, the United Kingdom, rest of Europe, North America, and internationally. It operates in two segments, Business Area Mines and Business Area Smelters. The company explores for copper, zinc, nickel, lead, gold, silver, platinum, and palladium deposits. It operates the Aitik, the Boliden Area, and Garpenberg mines in Sweden; the Tara mine in Ireland; and the Kylylahti and Kevitsa mines in Finland. The company's products include zinc and lead ingot, copper cathode, gold bar, and silver granule, and other products, such as sulphuric acid and iron sand; copper, lead, nickel, and zinc concentrates; and by-products, including copper sulphate, zinc clinker, copper telluride, selenium, nickel matte, and crude nickel sulphate, as well as palladium, platinum, rhodium, iridium, ruthenium, and osmium concentrates. The company sells its metals primarily to industrial customers, as well as construction, electronics, and automotive industries; copper to wire and copper rod manufacturers; and lead to battery manufacturers. It has a strategic collaboration agreement with LuleÃ¥ University of Technology to develop technology and strengthening competence in mining and smelting operations. Boliden AB (publ) was founded in 1924 and is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden.

BOTX.ST.summary: Botnia Exploration Holding AB (publ), together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration of precious and base metals in Sweden. The company explores for gold, silver, lead, zinc, and copper. Its project portfolio includes gold and sulphide ore projects with five exploration licenses and two processing concessions in the VargbÃ¤cken and FÃ¤bodtjÃ¤rn areas. The company was founded in 2007 and is based in Nacka Strand, Sweden.

NIO.ST.summary: Nordic Iron Ore AB (publ) engages in the exploration, development, and mining of iron-ore deposits in VÃ¤sterbergslagen, Sweden. The company also explores for apatite, lanthanum, gold, and copper deposits.
